I love that the place is immaculately clean and pretty and inviting. Classy Beautiful Hole in the Wall:)  I will continue to meet my favorite people in the Bay at Mozzeria when I come to town.
author: Julia Cameron D.

description:
I was debating between a four and a five but I'll round up because they were still working out the new operating kinks and it's a family operation - come on folks, that is what yelp is all about!

From a food standpoint, it's good. not as good as Tony's award-winning margherita but definitely just as good as some of his other pizzas.  As for una pizza napoletana, from a pure food comparison, it's probably a bit better but hey, it's also 67% more expensive + another 45m to 90m of your life wasted waiting in line.  I had the margherita pizza and the pancetta with carmelized onion pizza.  Both were great.  

I would call this place the People's Pizza joint.  This is a place with really good pizza that only costs $12-$14 a pie and appetizers cost $5-7.  You don't have to wait in line.   They actually take reservations instead of making you wait in the cold for no good reason.  It's family friendly and did I already mention?  It's affordable!  It's just one of those super unpretentious neighborhood joints owned by a hard-working family where you can enjoy some excellent pizza with some friends or family without being given "the eye" by hipsters and pizza purists.

P.S., don't forget to try their namesake Mozzeria appetizer.  It's a bar of mozzarella cheese lightly fried to perfection and topped with amazing marinara sauce!  The sauce was so good, I asked for a side of it to dip my pizza crusts in.
author: Susan L.

description: Great food. Love the service. Whoever does the hiring here is doing a great job. Keep it up!
author: Grey Z.

description:
Wow.

The food was outstanding. I love the pizza - good bubbly crust, perfectly salty and powdered with a little char and great toppings. Even the appetizers were fantastic (Get the mozzeria bar, just do it. Trust me.)

The service was amazing. Roxy and Adam were so very kind. The people were so friendly, all smiles and so sincere. You could tell everyone has so much heart and loves their job. It was a wonderful experience and I will be back many, many times.
author: Zach S.

description:
Serious fan! I want to go back right now!

While I adored the service and the cute space and just the vibe in general - the focus is definitely on the food for me :)

Side-note: The entire experience seems to guide the focus towards the food. The decor is simple and streamlined, the music is clearly there but never distracts, etc

Definitely worth trying:
- Margherita (with buffalo di mozzarella) - simple, but elegant
- Roasted asparagus / goat cheese / garlic / truffle goodness
- Squash ravioli - slightly musky spicey in that wonderful autumn sense

We devoured both pizzas! So tasty. The pizza itself is extremely thin (with a sizeable, chewy crust) - but I think that only highlights the flavors / toppings - which were wonderful!

Probably wouldn't try again (i.e. I'd prefer to try something else on their yummy menu):
- Burrata (I personally don't buy into the burrata hype that has taken over SF)
- Gnocco Fritti (the ricotta with the sauce is tasty, but I would skip the crispy fritti)

Recommend!
author: Helen D.

description:
Tried a slice today from a friend who came in my office and seriously insisted I try this pizza although I wasn't hungry.  He knows I like thin pizza.  Admittedly, I was pretty impressed. 
It was delicious, simple goodness, very flavorful & made me want more.  And that will happen soon because now I'm really curious.

Not that it should be a 'selling point' by any stretch but I was really impressed when I learned it's a deaf owned restaurant with video relay service. That, to me, is just plain awesome.

I really hope they do well because it's always inspiring to see people "taking their passions and making them happen" in the words of Irene Cara.
author: Athena S.

description: This place is cozy, quiet, and friendly. I had an amazing hibiscus saison, and my friend who ordered a zinfandel loved his wine.  We ordered the raddichio pizza and were impressed by the interesting combination of flavors it had with the root-y bitterness of the raddichio, nuttiness of the almonds and saltiness of the cheese.  The crust was soft and very chewy, and I really enjoyed the meal!
author: Diana H.

description:
The first thing that stands out about Mozzeria is the staff - everyone is deaf and uses ASL.  Once I become accustomed to my initial surprise, the rest of my dinner was splendid (if a bit warm - the place does not have A/C).

My favorite dish here is the Italian sausage pizza - that is hands down one of the best pizzas I've had in SF, any style.  All of my dishes were solid and tasty, but the pizza stood out and was the highlight of my night.
author: Josh Q.

description:
Not really all that great -- I've had much better.  The wine was very meh; the burrata appetizer was *huge* -- and while burrata is usually delicious, but this was only so-so, and there was just this big *block* of it; the pizza was underwhelming.  I hate to say it, but I can't help wondering if limited communication with our hearing-impaired server hampered the meal -- I usually do a lot of talking with the servers to get an idea of what the food and drinks will be like, and it was just impossible to do when we were scribbling notes back and forth.

I won't be back.  Which is too bad, because I really wanted to like this place.
author: Nori H.

description: Oh my gosh... the pizza here is to DIE for! I can't have cow's milk (allergy), so I was overjoyed to see the goat cheese pizza on the menu! It had goat cheese, eggplant, and tomatoes. The pizza was cooked to perfection and I ate half (yes, HALF) of it all by myself... it was that good. I also loved the hot coppa with garlic-stuff olives. The waitress was super sweet and signed with my deaf brother-in-law and spoke at the same time for those of us that were hearing. It was a wonderful experience and we will be coming back for more!
author: Ashley Q.

description: Awesome place!! Delicious pizza and wonderful service! Hole in the wall. Fun to sit at the bar and watch them make the pizza! Long line when they opened right at 530! Make sure to call ahead and make reservations! Everyone is so nice here! Great atmosphere! Owners are so nice and Her two young kids work here too! Family run and owned! Deaf community all know sign language and some hearing. Yum!
author: Marisa K.

description: Fantastic Neopolitan pizza, as everyone's saying.  Just wanted to correct the info on this page: you can indeed order delivery through Caviar, with a $4.95 delivery fee.
author: Michelle C.

description: Super tasty, great combinations of 'za! The staff is all hearing impaired - they are super attentive and sweet! Wonderful service!
author: Dave G.

description: My daughter is studying American Sign Language, and I took her here.  Truth be told, I had no interest in going and was doing this only for my daughter.  What a pleasant surprise this restaurant turned out to be! Not knowing ASL, and having a waiter who was deaf, the place has the gentle excitement of like being in a foreign country where pointing, smiling and expressive gestures help guide you along your way. Putting that aspect aside, the food is simply outstanding.  We tried three different pizzas, and some roasted vegetables that captured the flavors of winter.  I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a wonderful meal and experience!
author: Mark B.

description: We ordered from Mozzerria and waited one hour past the promised time and still no pizza. Apparently they use Eat 24 for delivery. Needless to say, we'll never order again from either. We cancelled our order and ordered from Patxis.
author: Arturo M.

description: Really cool place. Went with a group of 8, we decided to go with the family style menu. OMG..for $25 per person they give you so much food.  I think it was 4 or 5 different appetizers, 2 different pasta dishes and 4 pizzas.  The pastas were really good, actually all the food was delicious.  They do go a little overboard using cheese, as almost all the dishes incorporated it somehow.  Definitely give it a try.
author: Dilly M.

description:
I ate here with a large group and my feelings were mixed about this place.  I will return and try it again due to the great food but hope the service is better.

First, I am not hearing impaired and like many other posters, did not find there to be an issue communicating with the staff.  It was kind of like dining in a foreign country where you don't speak the language - a combo of pointing, gesturing, and writing at times.  That was different but kind of neat, and not an issue at all.  The host, bar tenders, and waiter all seemed totally cool dealing with non-ASL folks.

Next, they were super accomodating in fitting in a large group on a Saturday night, which was so welcome and unexpected.  I did my reservation via email and the restaurant was prompt to respond to emails.  We had a wait a little bit for our table but not too long or beyond normail waits on a Sat night.

The food was delicious.  Yummy pizzas, creative appetizers, good wine selection.  I really enjoying everything I tried.

Third, this is where the downfall was - the service was very spotty.  The server repeatedly took our silverware and plates between courses and never gave us new ones so when the food showed up, we have nothing to use to eat the food.  Then, there would be a wait and the food would get cold.  Also, they forgot to cut the pizzas - when you are sharing food, as we were, this was a challenge.  Especially when I didn't have any silverware to try to DIY.  Also, they forgot to give us napkins, and took some napkins away between courses (??) without replacing them.  So, there was a constant effort to wave down a server and get what we needed - it was annoying and a bit of a challenge if a waiter wasn't looking right at you.  All that being said, I think they were down staff that night so maybe it was an anomoly.  I hope so, bc asde from the service, I really liked this place.
author: Denise B.

description: Mad at myself for waiting so long to come here.  Fantastic service and excellent pizza.    I liked the opportunity to freshen up my sign language, but the staff are so talented that you really don't need it.  The Burrata was excellent.
author: April M.

description: Food was delicious and all five kids ate every bite of everything on the table.  They couldn't get enough and said it was the best pizza they have ever eaten!
author: Amy A.

description:
Really good pizza with a great chewy crust.  Not as crisp as other pies we've had, but we definitely enjoyed the chewiness throughout.  The margherita was delicious, but the asparagus / blue cheese / truffle oil was a bit to overpowering, both with the cheese and the truffle oil.  

The burrata, which was super soft and creamy, and the pumpkin ravioli, which was a little on the small side, were both very tasty, but I'll be back for the pizza.
author: Pilan C.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday dinner. The pizzas were yummy although on the smaller end.. we were a party of 12 and ended up ordering 3-4 appetizers and 6 pizzas, and some of us were still hungry. 

Quality of food and ingredients are great though.
author: Sofia R.

description:
First off I dont care if they are deaf or blind or if they talk loud or if they come from Alabama, Los Angeles, or Portland, etc.

I went to Mozzeria because I was looking for a thin crust wood fired oven pizza conveniently located close to home. 

Food: A+
I had the margherita d.o.p. which turned out to be just about perfect. As good as any margherita I've had at Tony's or Una Pizza Napoletano

Wine: A
A glass of Italian Pinot Noir. Very nicely balanced(nice start/middle/finish)

Service: A
No issues, no attitude, professional.

Mozzeria is a place that I feel that the cooks care about the food. The pizza I ate was everything I had hoped for. 
I will go back and try some of the other dishes soon.
author: Phillip B.

description:
Cute little space in the Mission where the dishes definitely show some promise but they still have some growing up to do...

La Mia Oca Burrata: I typically expect burrata to be characterized by a silky texture, however the burrata here is overly on the dense side and a bit grainy in texture, in particular as you work towards the center of the burrata. I will say the basil oil was quite a nice touch adding a this nice bright freshness to the dish. Dish is good just not exactly as expected, perhaps it was just our serving since other reviews rave about this dish.

Crispy Pork: VERY crispy pork; if you're looking for a succulent, fatty piece of pork belly, definitely steer clear. Would have preferred just a nice crispy pork skin with the meat simply braised/slow-cooked and served as-is rather than deep frying the entire piece. Accompanying white beans were delicious.

Pizza: I don't recall which pizza we ordered, nor do I recall it being particularly memorable...I think that says enough. Simply not up to par with some of the more well-known pizza establishments in the city but I think they'll get there as they continue to break-in their huge pizza oven.

Will probably give this place a shot in the future
author: David H.

description: After having a terrible experience next door at the ramen place, my girlfriend and I walked in here.  BEST MOVE WE COULD HAVE DONE!  The food is great with some really nice wines.  All at a very reasonable price.  The bombolini for dessert rocks!
author: Arie K.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. I love to support establishments which employ people who have disabilities. I had read that the owners were deaf, but I didn't realize that most of the staff is deaf as well. 

My issue is mostly about the poor service we received. We arrived at 730 with a large group. It took a while for  the group to settle in. Once we did, it was around 8pm before the order was taken. The orders came out one at a time. We ordered first and everyone else had eaten before it became apparent our order had been forgotten. The waiter seemed to be confused about what we had and came back a few times, but it wasn't clear that we'd been forgotten at that point. We finally got our pizza...at 915pm. 

While the pizza was good, it only had a few pieces of meat on it. At $20 for a 12" pizza, I would expect a little more. And after waiting for more than 1 hour for this pizza, it was an added insult. If I was reviewing on the pizza, I would give it 3 stars simply because it's overpriced for what you get. I'd rather eat at Little Star... 

We got no apology or any kind of acknowledgment about this oversight. Had we not been with a large group, we would have canceled our order. While we do not sign, there was a person at our table who did, not to mention paper on the table to write on. The waiter could have communicated status of the forgotten pizza and given an apology to us....but he did not. 

Sadly, we will never go back again.
author: Joan S.

description:
My friend and I ate here for dinner tonight. It was mediocre. The pizza was like naan with toppings, the burrata appetizer was abide average and the bucatini with veal meatballs was just okay. The meatballs needed breadcrumbs and were pretty heavy while the sauce was good. 

Overall it's nice to support this business but for the cost I think you could do better.
author: Sam K.

description: Came to their food truck at the ERF yesterday. We got a Margherita pizza, which was HOT and DELICIOUS!!!! The crust was perfectly chewy, and the sauce was light and very flavorful.
author: Cheryl C.

description: Excellent pizza. I ordinarily don't like unconventional toppings like barbecue, etc. I was going to go with the Margherita (one of their specialties), but at the last second, switched to the Peking duck (also a specialty). It was probably one of the best things I've ever eaten. Duck was succulent. Sesame seeds toasted while the pizza baked in a wood fired oven that smelled like I was near a camp fire. Scallions, cucumber, brown sauce like you get with real Peking duck. Texture of the dough was perfect. Fantastic.
author: Bib G.

description:
I went to Mozzeria for an ASL class assignment. The owners, along with a lot of the staff, are deaf. Our waitress was hearing, but we tried signing with her as much as possible (as per the assignment). We ordered wine, two pizzas and ended up getting two desserts as well.

Pros:
-the food! The food was delicious!
-atmosphere...the staff was super friendly, the waitress even let me ask her some questions about her experiences working there (for my paper). The owner even filled our water and made sure we were comfortable. It was nice seeing owners being involved.
-decor - the inside of the restaurant is simple, yet styled. I also like the music selection.

Cons:
-cost - the prices were reasonable, I suppose, but it was still a touch above what I'm comfortable paying for a small pizza.
-temperature - because the oven is smack in the middle of the restaurant, it was BOILING inside.
-wait time - it took quite awhile to get our food & check

All in all, it was a fun experience and I'd be interested in trying the brunch/lunch menu during the weekend sometime. It's also good to see a restaurant that recognizes and caters to the deaf community.
author: Laura C.

description: Pizza is my favorite food, and this was one of the best pizzas I've ever eaten, on par if not better than pizzas I've had in Norhern Italy, Paris and at Mozza in Los Angeles. My fiancé and I ordered the Mushroom and Margerita DOP (with buffala mozzarella), and both were superb. The crust was the perfect combination of crusty and chewy, with a touch of smoke from the wood fire oven. The sauce on the Margerita was perfect too, fresh and bright without tasting raw.
author: Konstantin G.

description:
I was greeted promptly & lovingly by familiar faces, and served with delicious food & house wine. it could not get sweeter than that! 
I loved their mozzeria bar, margherita pizza, and caramelized onions with point reyes blue cheese pizza. they were absolutely ah-mazing! 
I'm sure everything on the menu was as good or better, but I was way too stuffed to try anything else. 
THANKS!
author: noreen y.

description: Came here to do a report for my ASL class in high school. Did not get to sign much (this was about a year ago and the woman who took my order was hearing) but I did get to meet Russ. Great pizza (I had the cheese pizza) and nice modern little set-up. Would like to come back soon and sign a little more!
author: Alexa B.

description:
The flavors are spot on but the chewiness of the dough was something I couldn't pass on... 
But man, tastes like the real thing...it's just too dense...
author: Dario B.

description: I love the history behind this restaurant.  We brought our daughter here as she is studying ASL in school.  The food was awesome and with the restaurant being on the small side, it's great that you can make online reservations.  Even though only one of us knew sign language, we were all able to communicate very well with our waiter who was extremely attentive.  I highly recommend!
author: Sheri C.

description: Staff was super nice, but the house made burrata was the worst burrata I've ever had.  It was dry and like a brick.  The fried wontons that went with it were pretty gross too. Pizza was okay, but overall no desire to go back.
author: Click C.

description:
Was really excited to eat here, so when I was finally able to go, I had high expectations. Was a bit disappointed. Maybe over time they'll get into a better rhythm and become more consistent.

Let's start with the definite positives:
Liked the atmosphere, bright, modern and comfortable. The service was friendly and attentive. It was definitely an interesting eating experience. It felt like our table was in the minority, in terms of hearing. Most of the employees and a large number of the guests were all signing. Our server was patient with us as we tried to communicate our questions and feedback about the food. 

Food:
apps: duck rillete / prosecco cubes- each ingredient on this plate was pretty good, but not sure about the combination.
humboldt fog/chestnut honey - unlike the duck rillete, this combination worked well and was one of the favorites of the night.

Pizza:crust was chewy in the good parts and a nice smoky flavor from the oven, but it was a bit inconsistent as there were soggy spots. 

We had: caramelized onion / fresh thyme / bleu cheese
pancetta / fresh mozzarella / caramelized onion - between the 2, i liked this better, probably b/c of the pancetta

Pasta: overall, not too impressed, definitely overpriced. Small portions and while the pasta was well cooked, not that different. 
trofie / pesto / milk braised pork / pepperonata 
chitarra / neapolitan pomodoro / crispy pancetta

Dessert: We had the chocolate fondant cake on rum anglaise / whipped cream. Very rich, very sweet. could work for some but did not for our table.
author: Eugene P.

description: Great aroma and tasty pizza!  When I ate the prosciutto pizza, the owners greeted me, my wife, and friends.  Neapolitan traditional pizzeria was perfect.  The owners told a brief story how he makes homemade Italian tomato sauce daily.  Very tasteful tangy, and fresh sauce.  My wife loved the Italian sausage pizza.  Your appetite will be overly satisfied.  Enjoy the view of the authentic wood burning oven from Naples at Mozzeria!
author: Gerardo D.

description:
Great pizzas simply prepared & delicious.  

Lovely service!
author: Robert B.

description:
Mozzeria was a complete dinning experience.  While it lacks the hype of Delfina and Loconda (and the hipster attitude), it measures up at a fraction of the cost.  The restaurant is cozy (i.e., it is a small space).

I dined with my wife and kids.  We started off with veal-pork meatball parmesan and vegtables.....the vegetables (beets, kale, carrots, zucchini) were prepared in a smoker and were delicious.  We then had the sausage pizza, pasta and the desserts were also prepared with care and were excellent.  The service was solid too.  I plan on coming back, especially if they decide to put a steak or fish on the menu.

This was a pleasant surprise for us.  I had planned going to Delfina, but I wanted to try this place based on yelp reviews and articles I read about it.  Mozzeria did not disappoint.
author: E A.

description: We had such a lovely time at Mozzeria. I happened to come across this small place and arranged a small get together dinner and the food did not disappoint. I highly recommend this little treasure in the Mission!!
author: Maya B.

description: Great food, wonderful service, good wine. The only reason it's not 5 stars? The music was a bit heavily rocked out for me. I'd still eat there again.
author: Arturo P.

description: No good.  The food was very bland both times we ate here, particularly the pizza.  Bad pizza.  Service was fine but I don't really care about service, just food.
author: California B.

description: Food was excellent.  Prices were a bit high for what you got but service was excellent.  All the servers were deaf.  So novel, loved it!  They were all on their game!
author: Sally L.

description: Our whole meal here was fabulous.  We were basically licking our plates.  The pizza was delicious, the pasta was incredibly rich and flavorful and the cheese was perfect.   I can't wait to go back.
author: Courtney C.

description:
As mentioned before in previous reviews, most of the staff members are hearing-impaired, though this isn't a huge inconvenience, so much as a learning experience.

The pizza is great, salads are interesting, they have good wine selection and great service. 

Notable favorite:
Radicchio pizza
author: Kari G.

description: Had to come here for an ASL school project. I wasn't too impressed with the portion sizes and the lack of variety in the ingredients with the pizza from here. The prices were not reasonable in my opinion. The waitress was nice and we had no trouble communicating with her.
author: Jay L.

description: Outstanding! Came here with a friend and we both loved it. The sauce on the eggplant dish and pizza were to die for, and the atmosphere was relaxing and pleasing, making for easy conversation. There was even a vegan pizza option, which is rare. Big fan of the wine choices too...will definitely be back.
author: Scott S.

description: I have been here twice and it never disappoints. You should definitely get the kale salad. The classic Margherita is phenomenal and I would also recommend the Roast Duck pizza; it works flavor wise.
author: A. R.

description: Love it! great $20 prix fixe, great pizza, great calm atmosphere. AWESOME!
author: Bowen D.

description: There's actually a lot of good Neapolitan pizza in SF, but Mozzeria is our favorite. Delicious crispy crust from the wood-fired oven, real bufala mozzarella, and their appetizers are great too. The staff is warm and friendly. And they take reservations and are not as crowded as Delfina.
author: Dan C.

description: The pizzas and salads here are so delicious. Everything was so fresh and made so quickly. I really liked the house made ginger iced tea.
author: Devon H.

description:
I can't say much more than AMAZING!

We had the Family Style dinner which gave us 10 different plates (salad, 3 appetizers, 2 pasta plates, 3 pizzas -including a Peking Duck pizza- and a delicious, but light dessert). I will definitely be back for more!
author: Tammy M.

description: Don't listen to people saying the food is not good, they just don't know how a real pizza is!!! I've been in every pizzeria in NY where I'm from and love to discover new ones when I travel. Forget SF, even in the pizza's hometown Napoli, the pizza is not so good. Ask the pizzaiolo a white pizza with bufala mozzarella and cherry tomatoes, you will understand the difference between the real and the crap you knew before coming in this restaurant. And they didn't offer me a free meal for a positive review, as you might think!
author: Ned D.

description: Went 3 weeks ago and we still can't stop thinking about the food. The Pizza was amazing and the homemade banana split was a dessert worth saving room for. We happened to be walking through the city and stumbled across it. It took a few seconds to realize everyone inside was deaf, once we did it made the experience even more enjoyable. Ready to go back this weekend again.
author: Ben M.

description:
Lovely restaurant with delicious food and attentive staff.
Individuals in other posts who have commented on unavailability of phone communication are doubtlessly (yet incredibly) unaware of the hearing impairment of everyone who works at Mozzeria.  Would advise getting one's facts straight and focusing on the important things - the excellent food and service while one is present in the restaurant.
author: Em P.

description: Margarita pizza was off the charts. This was my first time here and it was the perfect venue for a weeknight outing. The space is quaint and the decor casual. The menu isn't too big or too small. There are plenty of delicious items to choose from - I ordered obviously the Margarita and the Bucatini. Bucatini is one of my favorite pastas but it is very hard to get right. This time it was a little under cooked but I'm willing to give it another shot. The staff was very nice and attentive. I want to go back with a bigger party and try more dishes. If you live in the neighborhood - this is a must do.
author: Kelly C.

description: Food ranges from decent to very good. It's never standout. But it's a nice neighborhood spot, and the Tuesday and Wednesday meal specials are fantastic values -- you'll be hard pressed to find a similar deal anywhere in the Mission. And it's never crowded on those days, so reservations aren't even required (although they are accepted).
author: David C.

description: This review is to address the handling of a Gilt City Voucher and why despite good food I would never return again.  I dined with two people who had a three course meal voucher for 2 and planned to order my own meal. When I placed my order for a pizza the server insisted I also had to order a small plate even though I didn't want it. She handed me a piece of paper that said they 'suggest' I order one and then told me I had no choice and it was part of their agreement with Gilt to enforce dining options on the whole party. I do not think think it stated that on the voucher and have never heard of a business punishing a full paying diner for eating with people who had a coupon. This a shady bad business practice and I will never return.
author: Lisa K.

description: Great pizza place and Deaf owned and operated. Great Margharita pizza a delicious thin crust.
author: Ivette C.

description: We got the Brussels sprout pizza and let me say it was delicious! And it doesn't even have tomato sauce! The service was amazing, the prices are reasonable and I want to go back for that same pizza desperately.
author: Laurence S.

description: I was very excited to try this pizza (per the reviews here) but I wasn't impressed. Maybe it was because I got delivery and you must eat the pizza warm and fresh out of the oven...The dough felt like perhaps it wasn't cooked enough..? The Marguerita one was the good, I was not impressed with the mushroom one- at all, it lacked flavor, it was very bland and I would not order this again. The sausage one was just OK. I can't say that I would recommend, unless the pizza tastes 80% better in the restaurant.
author: Mimi C.

description:
Went to Mozzeria last night for the first time with a group of friends.  I LOVED their margherita pizza and veal-pork meatballs -- amazing flavor!!  Pumpkin ravioli was good too.  There were only only two things I didn't really care for: the burrata small plate (I'm used to high quality burrata and this one was just ok) and their dessert that came with our meal. 

Prices are very reasonable.  Ended up getting the "Italian Feast for Two" for $39 with a friend - you get 2 small plates, a pizza, a pasta, and a dessert.  It was more than enough and we were stuffed!
author: Jessica J.

description:
Mozzeria got the name for a reason.  

Fab margaritas DOP pizza.  Great house red. Nice atmosphere. The seating arrangement was kind of awkward with so many people standing around but this setting is understandable because of the performance that took place. I came for brunch and I see there are a listing of pizza after i ordered DOP that looks so delicious. I look forward to try them when i come back.   I also heard limello ice-cream is a heaven so I shall try that too...

This restaurant is new and has great potentials. 

Happy customer..
author: Jac C.

description: The staff and whole deaf experience is charming; but I'd pick Delfina over Mozzeria in a heartbeat.  Only tried the pizza, so I'd be willing to go back and taste test the pasta.
author: Mercutio k.

description:
as with anything that has a big hype i tend to stay away so I can go in and try the place with less expect ion. I have had great luck enjoy many movies this way because when the expectation bar is set high i am expecting perfection. 

I am happy that I waited and thoroughly enjoyed my experience. The place smelled tremendous and looked wonderful. I know ASL and being able to communicate clearly with our waiter was awesome. I was a little concerned with the large group in the back of the restaurant as I thought service might be a little slower. not the case our water was there and he attended to us like we were the only ones in the place.

I am not a big salad person but was convinced to try the salad with a mustard dressing.... OK for this I would eat more salads. 

next was the Prosciutto pizza. the waiter explained how italian pizza was different in that the toppings were applied to the crust after the crust was taken out of the oven. yum. 

this was the first of many times I will enjoy this restaurant.
author: Joseph C.

description:
I was going to a movie showing in the Mission with a a few people I know and a few I hadn't met and was looking for a place to eat in the Mission that would appeal to everyone.  

I chose Mozzeria because it had an appealing menu and the prices were reasonable.  Plus it was only a block away from the theatre. 

We arrived to find the very pleasant co-owner Melody holding an iPad.  I had read that the owners and most of the staff were hearing impaired but was unsure how certain situations would be handled.  She pointed to our name on the iPad and we confirmed it was us and we were seated with a regular and specials menu.  The service was attentive, professional, and friendly.  Other than pointing to our selections on the menu, there wasn't really any difference than any other dining experience except for... absolutely....amazing.....food....!!!

Several of us had the pea shoot salad, which had a touch too much dressing for my liking but otherwise was really delicious.  It had pea shoots, blue cheese, mango and hazelnuts.  Another person in our party had the beet salad and thought it was great.

For dinner I tried the gnocchi with veal meatball.  This is not your typical gnocchi.  They were browned til they became crispy, then tossed with a delicious pomodoro sauce and served with 3 small veal meatballs that melt in your mouth.  They was some other type of sauce on the bottom that almost tasted like a mole sauce, but became a smoky delicious combo when mixed with the other components.  Other people in our party tried the blue cheese and onion pizza and loved it, the butterfish special was deemed "the best fish I've ever had", and I would tell you about the japanese pumpkin ravioli but she refused to share.

For dessert we had a good but not fantastic cheesecake and sublime little fried dough ball like items filled with strawberry jam, rolled in cinnamon sugar, and laid to rest on a bed of chocolate sauce.  We finished all  this with some of the best coffee we have tasted.  

Mozzeria is a definite must!
author: Erin O.

description:
4 stars for great pizza dough, -10,000 stars for service and policy.

We were a group of 3 and went there on Sunday night around 7.30pm.  We were told the wait would be about 5-10 mins.  We got seated around 8pm even though there was an empty seat available around 7.45pm.  They forgot about us, and seemed too busy anyway to try to seat us.  Happens, OK.

There were a few problems with the management of the place.  First of all, they were doing a HUGE take out order, I want to say in the 30 mins we were waiting, we saw about 15-20 pizza boxes go out the door with Try Caviar.  They were just inundated!  Also, the owner lady (or she seemed like she owned the place) was juggling a gazillion things at once - manning the register, filling up beer pints, opening wine bottles, filling up wine glasses, taking other orders, serving, overseeing the cooking staff.  People in restaurants have different roles to expedite the customer process, this place needs to change!  A lot of small business owners have the tendency to want to micro manage everything, and this is fine if you sit in an office and waste just your time, but a restaurant has customers who don't want to wait forever.

I saw one girl wait for about 15 mins in the front of the resto while we were waiting and then after trying to talk to someone and anyone, but failing to do so and then just walking out of the restaurant.  I would have done the same except we wanted to use our Gilt City coupon.

Once we sat down, no one came for us.  I had to flag someone down to give us water.  15 mins after we sat down, the owner lady came to take our order.  She saw that we had a coupon and then took 2 of our menus away, since our coupon was only for 2 people.  I expected she was going to bring us the special menu.  She did not come back till 15 mins later.  I was watching her since I was extremely irritated and she was doing all those things I mentioned above.  I flagged a few other staff people down, and at 8.30pm she finally brought us the right menu and we said we were ready to order right away since we were not going to wait another 15 mins to order.  We were going to order from the Gilt City coupon, plus an extra pizza from our friend, but she forced our friend to order an extra appetizer too, and wrote "policy" on her notepad because we had a coupon.  I've done this many times where we bring a friend and just make sure we order a nice good entree, so this was shocking to me.  At this point my party was too tired to argue and they just ordered something else.  Had it been just me, I would have either refused or walked out.  I was seriously pissed.

Well, the food came out at a shockingly good pace compared to what we had expected from the experience.  It was good fare, but nothing special.  The house wine was terrible.  Service was horrendous, though the people seemed nice and friendly, but their system just needed a revamp.  I would NEVER go back again.

If you want decently good food, and don't mind spending a lot of time waiting, knock yourself out and go to Mozzeria.

Short addendum: someone told me I should mention that a number (or maybe all?) of the people working at this establishment were deaf, I did not want to mention that and sound like a bigot, but maybe I should.  I feel like this in general this could slow down the process a bit, but it was way more so than it really should have.
author: Michelle L.

description: Mozzeria claims to be open for weekend brunch effective January 1, 2012. Its website, neighborhood flyers, OpenTable, even the sign on its door, state that it opens for brunch at 10:00 am on the weekends. Yet twice I successfully made brunch reservations (first in mid January, then again in mid February), only to find out that brunch at Mozzeria doesn't seem to exist. The first reservation was canceled by the restaurant without explanation. I figured that it was new and I was willing to give them a pass. However, when I showed up the second time (a full month later) with an OpenTable brunch reservation, the door was locked, the lights were off, and it was clear there was no brunch. For my trouble, I was rewarded with a "No Show" on my OpenTable account. Not cool, Mozzeria.
author: Marie F.

description:
I don't rate a lot on yelp, mostly because I don't want to share my best-kept secrets, so this should help you understand that I want to make my vote heard, and make sure this restaurant succeeds! The are members of Vera Pizza and they kill it with their wood fired oven Neapolitan pizza.

Mozzeria is a pizza sanctuary. The pizza (and atmosphere/customer service)  here has many times changed my mood.  

Creative topping combinations as well as the basic, and the crust, is mind-blowing. The side-dishes and other entrees are creative, well executed and super interesting food experiences.

Staff cannot be beat - xo!
author: Jennie B.

description:
After that last experience, I had to go back to check whether it was a fluke. It wasn't.

Roasted Peppers: just as good as the Gnocco Fritti, which is to say, amazingly good.

Roasted Squash Ravioli: nearly as good as last time; just slightly over-spiced. Mind, that only takes it down a notch from 'orgasmic' to 'amazing'. :-P

Recommendations for improvement, since I know the owner reads these ;-):
* more vegetarian non-pizza entrées (I'm not usually in the mood for pizza, and variety would be nice)
* include desserts on regular menu (they sound great, but I haven't ordered them 'cause I didn't think to save space ahead of time)

Also: the Pandora playlist they have is pretty good. Ironic for a Deaf-operated restaurant, but the choice and volume of mood music is actually better than most places!
author: Sai S.

description: great attention to detail on menu items for a casual place. the chef is clearly on task and talented. the burrata is as good as it gets anywhere.
author: Mr. L.

description: Love it!  The ambiance was light and fun and the food was great! Definitely going back.
author: E. P.

description: I wandered into Mozzeria with no idea what I was in for, but the staff was super delightful. The ASL waitress even gave me a charger for my phone! She will forever have my heart for that alone, before the fact that she was attentive, sweet, and let me know via a note that there were two huge groups and that was why service was a bit slower than usual. Honestly, I didn't even notice, but I definitely appreciated the heads up. The hostess was lovely, the chef was lovely (he gave me well-deserved teasing for ordering two pizzas. What? It was yummy! I was hungry!)... This place is full of awesome people, so even if the food weren't delicious, I'd be back. Plus, their playlist was pretty much directly taken from my iTunes, so... in short, I'll be Arnold. I mean back.
author: Sarah C.

description: i ordered through caviar and it took 2 hours to get here and was freaking cold..  rediculous...
author: Ryan M.

description:
Every time I go, the food gets better or is it me who gets better?!  Really delicious.  Worth every dollar spent on the food and atmosphere--warm, open, and comfortable.  At the Brunch on Easter, I had Easter Pizza. Yummy!  Perfect baked pizza, with delicious toppings, brown sugar crumbs!  

The waitress was effective and very pleasant.  It was very relaxing all the way.  ASL is my natural language and we conversed in perfect ASL and there was no misunderstanding in any form.  The only place in California is like that!

I most definitely will return, repeatedly.
author: Brian M.

description:
Imagine sitting at a table on a warm April evening with a cold beer (on draft) and the scent of pizza baking in a wood-burning oven sifting through the air. People walking by are courteous and friendly. The waiters don't just smile at you and walk by, they ask how you're doing and actually bring you some cold water to offset the beer.

And the food?? We (group of 7 people) ordered a lot-the best way to sample a restuarant's menu all in one-sitting. Everything we ordered was fresh, full of flavor and served at the correct temperature.

PIZZA (1st star): The pizza is thin-crusted with a bubbly outer crust, we had three different pies: Margherita, Quattro Formaggio and Roasted Asparagus. LOVED, LOVED, LOVED it! We emptied our plates, each round. We also shared a pasta dish from the evening specials menu-very fresh and flavorful, this dish also got divoured. Pasta is very fresh and tasty.

SMALL PLATES (2nd star): We had about three different small plates before the pizza came: Rainbow beet salad, House-made burratta and Roasted Japanese Eggplant. Each dish had the right balance of seasonings to bring out and enhance the flavor of the vegetables and cheese. 

DESSERTS (3rd star): Oh my, the desserts....we had the: Hazelnut panna cotta, Lemon cheesecake and Bombalino (small donut holes rolled in cinnamon sugar and filled with strawberry jelly with chocolate sauce on the side). I am guilty of hoarding the Bombalino, it was THAT good. 

SERVICE (4th star): Both the owner and our waiter were great about making us feel welcome and comfortable. Our waiter checked on our table frequently, we got water refills more than once and didn't have to wait long for additional items (more beer or wine). The waiter had the kitchen cut the pizzas in 8 slices (usually they slice it in 4 or 6) so that we could share easily and brought us another round of clean plates and untensils for our desserts. Good experience!

LOCATION (5th star): Getting there is EASY, 2 blocks away from 16th street Bart going towards the ocean. It's got a big sign at the front and is located on the main street, it's an open treasure you DON'T have to SEARCH for. 

Overall, it was a great dining experience. My whole group was satisfied and we will definitely return for more. 

Tip: Be sure to email for a reservation (regardless of your party size) the restaurant is small and fills up fast.
author: Foo D.

description:
I am in LOVE with this place! There aren't that many "Italian" restaurants in the Mission, so lucky for me I live next door to this one! I randomly decided to pop in on a Saturday evening and was bummed when we heard about the 2 hour wait for a table! Fortunately, we were offered bar seats at the spot!

We wanted to order everything off their menu, but alas we ended up going with their margherita pizza, a couple of pasta dishes, and a veggie platter. All were mouth watering worthy.

I will for sure be back in a heartbeat with a bigger appetite and a few friends.
author: Kitty K.

description: Loved this place. I took a group of 12 here a few weeks back for dinner and can only say great things about this restaurant.  We had appetizers, salads, variety of main courses and dessert and there were only compliments.  I will be back here.  If you are in the mission district I highly recommend giving Mozzeria a try.
author: Jeff R.

description:
I had an out-of-town friend visiting over the weekend, and she works as a sign language interpreter. She heard about this place online and really wanted to go (it was actually her only specific sight seeing request). She did all the communicating for us, but I could see it would be easy enough for my family on our own just by using the provided pen and paper as well as the standard "point at the menu."

We got the arrancini as an appetizer, and it was delicious. It's one of my favorite Italian items, and it was cooked and seasoned perfectly. My husband and I shared a marguerita pizza and our friends shared the pizza with sausage and fennel. My two very young girls were having a tough day and didn't want to eat, and the waitstaff was very nice to them in spite of their grumpy moods. It was a very family friendly spot. 

The pizzas were good, if a bit small for the price. My husband and I agreed we should have ordered one each or else something else to split. But I'm originally from NY (my friend also lives there) and I'm a pizza snob. I would definitely go back. The sauce was amazing- many places have bitter or tasteless sauce. This was perfectly sweet and flavorful. I will definitely order a dipping sauce for the crust next time. 

I actually enjoyed how quiet the restaurant is. The music is very subdued. We could actually talk and hear one another. A big plus for me. 

Dessert was doughnuts with chocolate and whipped cream. Very tasty and there were a lot of them. 

My friend really enjoyed it as an ASL interpreter. But we all enjoyed the food and ambiance. My family will definitely be going again.
author: Joy B.

description: The pastas are amazing. I love the chili rigatoni (with cheese on side) and the almond and celery root agnolotti. I always get a table though I know that won't last long because the food is so good!
author: Katie T.

description: This place is great & it was very cool to go to a place owned and operated by deaf people.  My daughter is taking ASL at USF college and we went here together as part of her studies.  The food was incredible & the price was great.  Very clean and very nice place
author: Deb H.

description: I can't believe I'm saying this, but Mozzeria is just as good as Delfina Pizzeria.  Delfina has been my favorite pizza joint in the city, so this is pretty major.  We rolled in Friday night on a mission for pizza and only pizza.  We got the margherita DOP and the duck.  To die for!  Crust is perfect (crunchy, but not too crispy...and thin) and piping hot out of the oven.  The toppings are tasty.  The duck pizza was surprisingly smokey in flavor and had the perfect amount of hoisin sauce on it.  Would definitely go back!
author: Wendy S.

description: Just had my second dinner at Mozzeria, and was again blown away by the quality of the ingredients and flavors here- not to mention the bang for your buck. Got pasta this time- the rigatoni- and I have to say, I am not a huge fan of lamb, and the lamb in this dish was AMAZING. Not to mention the burrata... I would also like to add that I find it ironic/extra impressive that a bar run mostly by deaf people has an awesome soundtrack that seems to be a mix of classic rock and 90's hits. Props to you, Mozzeria.
author: Katherine M.

description:
yuuuuum!

just a great place.. even made it better with the awesome BBE code.

great food, great service and just amazing atmosphere.. just have to try it before it gets too busy!

had crispy pork, japanese eggplant, pancetta pizza, japanese pumpkin ravioli and bombolini.. everything was spot-on!! 

:)
author: Sung C.

description: Great food. Helps to know ASL but not a must. Food is very good but small potions. Little pricey.
author: Thayne W.

description: I felt comfortable eating any pizzas since it was ASL world! Stuffs were kind to me and service was very good! I would love to pay much tips...!
author: Moeko N.

description: Fantastic restaurant and I found it really calming not to have a huge amount of talking going on. that said, my husband and I are not deaf and felt at ease to talk also although i would say 70% of the restaurant customers were deaf and signing. The pizza (salumi) is deeelicious, barata was excellent, the chocolate biombolini were fresh piping hot and so tasty. Highly recommend!
author: Bess F.

description: best pizza i've had in San Francisco. I had the margharita w/ bufalo mozzarella. i will be back!
author: Jonas H.

description: This is my fave birthday restaurant, for the food. I mean, I always get excited to practice my decade-old ASL, but then I inevitably realize that I have forgotten so much of it! Unless you live very nearby, I wouldn't recommend any brick oven pizza to be "take out" - it'll arrive steamed - too chewy. Amazing service with very PATIENT and accommodating staff.
author: Mary A.

description: I love this place!  I have been at least a half a dozen times and have had a good experience each time.  The atmosphere is both hip and pleasant.  The waitstaff is absolutely charming.  The food is fantastic with interesting flavors on pizzas, appetizers and desserts.  (I haven't actually tried the pastas.)  This past Saturday, I split two appetizers - the Fava Leaf Salad (avocado, almond, citrus, goat cheese) and a barrata and crostini that was on special.  Both were delicious.  The radicchio (gorgonzola, walnut, truffle honey, onion) pizza was really interesting - and very good.  For dessert, the brownie (vanilla ice cream, banana, walnut) sounded like it would be very plain, but was laced with some sweet and spices flavors that were quite intriguing.  The plates all seem just the right size - not too big, not too small.  I'll be back another half dozen times soon for sure!
author: Michelle D.

description:
wanted to wait until the unwritten cardinal rule of yelping has passed (as with visiting a restaurant at least three times).  mozzeria most definitely rocks my world!

with my first visit, I had the roast duck pizza.  delicious!  and my friend had the blue cheese with caramelized onions, which was out of the world!  I also happened to sample a margherita pizza - which was very good.  we also had the mozzeria bar - which was very very good!  plus the red cabbage bruschetta was wonderful, which surprised me because I wasn't truly fond of red cabbage.  

on my second visit - which was for a brunch.  I had the eggs benedict option.  it was on top of a pizza dough - and there were two of them (as with traditional eggs benedict dishes), but a bit too much for me as I got full after the first one, and couldn't even eat the second one.  the side salad was pretty good. 

on the third visit, I had the italian sausage and  fennel pizza.  I wasn't sure if I liked it - probably due to the white garlic sauce?  probably would be better with a tomato sauce instead?  however, the limoncello truffle was woo hoo stonking!  everybody in our group loved that dessert!

will I want to return for the 4th time?  you bet - for 5th, 6th, 7th time as well!

p.s.  I also love delfina (as I've been there several times).  and I wouldn't be able to pick either delfina or mozzeria as "better" than the other.
author: Dan B.

description: excellent buffalo cheese option and delicious desert options!  Heads up Parents, contrary to Yelp listing this place is not exactly baby friendly, it is a small space, hardly any room for strollers or child seats so keep that in mind.
author: Sharif R.

description: This place is pretty decent for the location and the service.  The pizza crust was perfect and so was the sauce.  We shared a margarita and wished we each got our own. Will love to go back for more.
author: Ting B.

description: The burrata was delicious, but both my and my husband's pasta dishes were both so salty that we couldn't finish them.
author: Barbara F.

description: Hands down the best margherita pizza in the city. This is as close to the real deal as you can get.
author: Y M.

description: Our Family went to Mozzeria. Those food Tastes so good! My son (age 11) said oh boy that is Pizza best ever taste and give 5 stars and want Live near place so he can order everydays. WE (parent) were pleasure that place and awesome pizza and dessert were so good!!  we surely come back again!
author: David R.

description: Very cool place and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu- gnocchi and ravioli are great starters.  Make sure to check if your pizza comes with red sauce and some even come without cheese but they can add it for you.
author: Stu K.

description:
Two minutes from mission and 16th bart -Give the gift of this place to your friends

Second time here and still in awe. This is my fav place to eat in the city. I'm not a foodie nor a food snob but because of this place I might become one. This is the standard that all other italian pizzeria's should strive to be. Building is cute and clean. Staff is so cute and fun. Watch the chefs prepare your meal in a spotless kitchen with care and confidence as you dine on amazing apps. Try the mini meatballs and cheese log and prepare to die. The Gnocchi is very unique take on traditional Italian classic with a ragu I dream about now. The pizza is addictive and like pavlov I droll at the thought of it. 
Second time we brought friends and they two are in love with Mozzeria.
Perfect staff, perfect food, perfect drinks, perfect prices (6-8 for apps and 13-18 for pizza) 
By the way any place that plays The Smiths while I munch on the best meal in the city qualifies as heaven.
author: Mia M.

description: Best pizza in California! Just like pizza in Italy. Charming staff, great service. Desserts were incredible too!
author: Susan I.

description: Pleasantly surprised by this little knook of a restaurant on 16th - menu is nice and service was good - the star attraction is the pizza and if you are on a pizza binge (as I have been lately), this is a good run at a good pie, but not great - when we got our pie it was a bit to soft in the middle and a bit cool, which was the let down.  Overall, above avg though and will give the place another shot.
author: Richard D.

description: Awesome, just awesome. The red sauce brought my friend to tears because their red sauce reminded her of her Grandmother in Italy's sauce. Serving that with a The veal meatballs are well seasoned and flavorful. The best meatballs I've ever had. The pizza is really, really good. The best I've had since I moved out from New York. The crust is thin and soft, but has great char on the bottom to give it the ability to hold up with some awesome toppings. The menu changes, but the crispy pork is always ridiculous. I can't even describe the excitement I had when I tried the crispy pork. If you eat pig, you need to try it. Good beer and wine list too.
author: Michael J.

description: An orchestral delight, the food is phenomenal, and the signing is the bouquet!  San Francisco's best kept secret, by far.
author: Jeff G.

description: Great pizza!  Light crust, seasoned perfectly.  Great experience for hearing people of incredible deaf talent!  We will return often!
author: Bob F.

description: I would come back here. Love the thin crust wood fired pizza. The service was excellent.
author: Toby V.

description: This is an amazing place, and definitely a "must-do" in the MIssion area of SF!  Located on 16th St, this bright little gem of a place owned by Melody and Russ has a wonderful staff who really make sure you feel comfortable.  The decor is bright and clean, but not too fussy.  They start off strong with a nice selection of beverages, both alcoholic and nonalcoholic.  The pizza oven teases one with wonderful aromas, and it is fun to watch them making and cooking the pizzas.  Their menu offers great Napolitian style pizzas, as well as a variety of cheeses and some incredible desserts.  Prices are reasonable, and the waiters and staff members all knowing sign is a definite plus.  SO glad I was able to eat here. I strongly recommend you make reservations-I made a reservation at the time they opened, and they fill up fast!  People like this place, and for good reason :)  Some of the best pizza I have ever had!
author: Alisa N.

description: Damn fine food, service and concept. Went with someone fluent in ASL, although the FOH is just as friendly and efficient if you're clueless and write everything down.
author: Jay E.

description: Had beet salad, gnocchi and asparagus pizza.  All outstanding.  Been back a couple times since our first visit and quality is consistently good.  Staff is very friendly and remembered us after only one visit.
author: Kevin M.

description: My cousin heard about this place through her ASL class and I sign as well so we decided to try it. Even if you don't sign, there are enough hearing members of the staff. Love how they use a fire burning oven that makes all the difference in the taste of the crust. The pruccuito (spelling?) pizza was good but the asparagus was amazing. All the desserts were super yummy too. Their house wine was surprisingly good. It was a little pricey but the food was good. You can also make reservations online.
author: M S.

description: This place is awesome! Sweet that it provides an opportunity for deaf people to serve as wait staff in an upscale environment. The food was delicious. Got a caprese like salad with some of the yummiest mozzarella I've had and a pizza with pear, brie, and pancetta. Will return soon!
author: Laura W.

description:
I'm not a fan of the Mission district, I have to admit, but the call of pizza was stronger!  

The ambience of the place is best described as 'neutral', and I would definitley struggle to associate it with pizza, were it not for the very cool freestanding oven right in the middle.  The background music was cool (Hendrix at low volume) and the staff were super friendly and patient.

I got there early and witnessed a baking tray full of unpeeled  Italian style tomatoes being pulled out of the oven, no doubt in preparation for being turned into super-tasty tomato sauce....yummy,  I thought, very promising.

I ordered the Pizza Margherita and the topings really were fabulous: the tomato sauce, the mozzarella, all very nice.  When I had the first bite, I thought that it was the best pizza in SF, really thin crust and hitting just the right spot between crunchy and not-too-crunchy.      But when I got to the border, it got kind of chewy, (actually, very chewy) and as the pizza cooled down, the rest of the slices got kind of chewy too....

So, a kind of frustrating near-miss, but still a good excuse to overcome my Mission Avoidance Syndrome (MAS).
author: Pascal M.

description: Had dinner here last night and I'm glad we made reservations and came early. This place fills up fast and it's no wonder why ... It is sooooo damn good! Sampled their barbera and pinot noir wines each distinctly different and delicious. Had the mozzeria bar which was crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside and melted in my mouth. The veal meatball was the perfect bite. The margherita pizza was on point and the potato gnocchi had 4 different flavors (bolognese ragu, fresh ricotta and roasted fennel) that came together in perfect harmony, easily one of the pest plates of food I have had in the city! The service was fast, friendly and efficient. Will happily be returning again and again and again!
author: Trish D.

description: wonderful !! deaf restuarut business but i know mozzeria have ASL staff to easy to communte to deaf customer
author: Lo S.

description: Great pizza and service.  My daughter recommended this restaurant because she is studying ASL.  Wish more restaurants were this quiet.
author: Jeff S.

description: We went to Mozzeria last weekend as we were in town. We had reservations to attend this new restaurant. When we arrived there, the atmosphere was lovely with a brick oven in sight and beautiful light features. We were seated nicely. We ordered a couple pizzas and a mozzeria bar, the restaurant's specialty. The pizzas were UNBELIEVABLY delicious!  The pizzas were presented with fresh mozzarella and basil among the homemade sauce. We had one pizza with duck which is also great. The mozzeria bar was covered with the homemade red sauce and melted cheese inside the bar. That was very good. We were very happy with our food. The service was great, We wish that we were living nearby, as for sure, we will go there often. :-)  I hope that one day, you will open another restaurant in southern California! :)
author: Branton S.

description: It was a very interesting night and I love that this restaurant serves the deaf community. We were not deaf and we felt a little on the outside, but that's ok. We were able to communicate by pointing to items on the menu, or writing requests on a pad. Food was yum.
author: Ava C.

description:
we had mostly a four star experience but i'm going to have to bump my rating down to 3 stars.  we had reservations at 7 and got there just a few minutes before.  they told us it would only be 5 minutes until we were seated.  720 rolls around and we're FINALLY seated.  just tell us itll be 20 minutes, not 5.

once we were seated, we had a great meal.  all the apps, pizzas, and bottles of wine are reasonably priced and delicious.  we had the burrata and gnocco fritto to start - both were delicious and pretty unique.  then we shared the margherita pizza, italian sausage pizza, and the pancetta pizza- all were great, though the margherita was definitely my favorite.  being a pizza snob, i liked the margherita because it had a great sauce.  the dough was stretched a tad too thin, though, and the pizza got a little soggy. the sausage and pancetta pizzas were both pretty awesome, too. for dessert we had the bombolini and the coffee cake with caramel, apples, and ice cream.  both were good, but nothing to write home about.

altogether, it was a really good meal and i would definitely want to come back here.
author: Lisa C.

description:
This gets 5 stars from me because the combination of great food (4 stars), bargain prices for that food, and being able to get a table on a Sat night really is as good as it gets.

Excellent authentic Neapolitan-style pizza (way better than Pizzeria Delfina's disappointing efforts for example) - crispy, chewy, slightly charred.  Everything else really good too, the burrata, the Mozzarella sticks.  Excellent service and did I mention the prices?  (A 3 course meal for 2 with wine and coffee for under $100 incl tax and tip is a bargain for food of this quality).
author: Ritch G.

description: This place is amazing!! Deaf owned and operated. Our waitress Tiffany was very patient when answering my questions about the food. Ended up getting the Sausage Pizza. Thin crust, red onion, fennel, and sausage...Delicious!! Definitely recommending this place to all my friends!! Keep up the great work!
author: Michelle M.

description:
The pizzas are simple but tasty. We tried the eggplant, which is good and more for sweet taste, and the bacon one, which was ok.

The home-made lemonade was good.

The service is good. but the waiting time for the pizzas was long (nearly 30 minutes) although the place was not packed. Better take a small plate before to keep you busy waiting!
author: Elisabeth M.

description: Had dinner here for the second time and was lucky enough to be served by the owner Melody. Everyone waves hello as you walk in and you instantly feel comfortable. All of the waitstaff are incredibly friendly. This is all well and good but then the food appears and it is even more amazing. Came for a blackboard eats deal and got no attitude. What a deal! The burrata is truly a standout here. So decadent and delicious. The pizza is perfectly crispy with just the right amount of air bubbles. I love watching them make the pizza from the bar then they take it out of the oven at the perfect time. Pasta was really rich and then the dessert, which was a mix of beignet and churro, was delicious as well. I really want this restaurant to succeed because they are doing everything right plus the food always delights. I have been recommending it to everyone I see!
author: Gretchen S.

description: Had an order of the Wednesday Special ($20): Roasted Japanese eggplant crostini, margherita pizza, and bombolini. Food was delicious, staff was understanding, and an the ambiance was contemplative.
author: Rishi C.

description:
So BF and I decided to check this place out last night because on Friday night because they offer a special pizza with roasted duck, hoisin sauce and green onions. Jason and I are huge fans of peking duck, so we went to sate our craving. We we arrived at 7 for our reservations, we were seated promptly. We glazed over the menu and decided to have one pizza and a couple of appetizers. The beat salad was ok, I have to say that the goat cheese on the salad was pretty much the only thing memorable on the salad. We also ordered the crispy pork, which was not crispy at all, but definitely had the right flavor profiles with white bean puree and the seasoning of the pork.
    After our appetizers came our pizza which was decent, but we were really hoping for a crisp duck skin add that crunch factor, but it just wasn't there. Still finding ourselves hungry ordered 1 slider @ $3 and shared the small bite. The slider was the best item on the menu out of all the other items we had for the evening including dessert. Don't waste your time with dessert. Save your money walk the 2 extra blocks and have some killer ice cream at bi-rite.
   All in all it was just meh. I give them the benefit of the doubt that they have only been open for 6 months, I mean the flavors are all there, but the execution is wanting. I am willing to revisit this place in six months to see if they have remedied their ailments.
author: Astrea M.

description: Mozzeria has not only the best margherita pizza in the city, it also has the friendliest staff around. I've had so many enjoyable evenings here, and I can't recommend this place highly enough.
author: Cara B.

description:
Just finished a great meal from Mozzeria!

We tried the buffalo mozzarella pizza and a roasted duck with hoison sauce. They were both really amazing! The duck was a stand out for me. The duck was cooked perfectly and the hoison sauce added a nice sweetness. The crust was crisp and tasty too. Great atmosphere and good service.
author: Carol W.

description: I went there for lunch and came away disappointed.  Pizza lacked flavor and prices were out of line of a 12 inch pizza.  Much better pizzas with more reasonable prices can be obtained elsewhere.  Parking is also an issue in this area.
author: David L.

description: Loved it!  Had the sausage pizza, eggplant crostini, and mixed green salad.  All delicious!  The house wine was not the best though.
author: Prakash R.

description: The pizzas here are thin crust. We got a special beet salad with homemade goat cheese, the gnocchi bolognese and the mozzarella di bufala pizza. Everything tasted good and I will be back, but my one complaint was with the amount of gnocchi - there were only a few gnocchi on the plate. They should double the amount in a serving, because it felt like we were just getting a few scraps. Really excited to try the special duck pizza they serve once a week though.
author: Julie B.

description: Wonderful establishment. The food was great and the staff was cheerful, helpful, and overall terrific. I will definitely be back again and I highly recommend it!
author: Laura H.

description: The 5 stars are for their pasta dishes and desserts.  Pizza is 4 stars- very good, but not the best in the city.  But their pastas- oh my.  We were three people and we shared three dishes, we all agreed the pork sugo was one of the best we've ever eaten.  The pumpkin ravioli was light and bright and super yummy.  They have good wines by the glass, and for the city the prices are very reasonable.  This was my second visit and I would definitely go back.
author: Dalia W.

description: What don't I love about this place?  Nothing. What do I love most?  That I don't have to say a damn thing from start to finish.  Best place to come and enjoy my perfect version of solitude - red wine, outstanding pizza, and silence (kinda).
author: candice T.

description:
Went once -- so far.  Great food. Delightful people. I am going back, and thinking of the various friends I want to share this place with.
Why not 5 stars? Service. Maybe it's inexperience, but mostly, I think it's under-staffed, at least for a night as busy as the one we went on. Big faux-pas was not knowing what diner got which dish (or announcing it clearly) so the vegetarian side of the table got an unpleasant surprise. 
But with their obvious commitment to making this a great place to eat, I'm heading back and expecting the best.
author: Renzo C.

description:
Fantastic food -- excellent wood fired pizza rivaling the best in the city (I want one now), delicious appetizers and salads.  Reasonable prices.  The owners are deaf, and charming.  Great location.  

The ambiance leaves a bit to be desired (did you really need the tv on?), and the service was sloooooooow...Which normally wouldn't bother me if I had a nice glass of wine, but it took about a half hour to get that glass of wine...

But definitely worth a repeat visit.
author: Dennis T.

description: The food was definitely decent - had the braesola, margherita pizza and the pumpkin ravioli (5 raviolis - small portion), but the service was very slow.  We waited for everything - to get water, to get the menus, to place our order, for our drinks, for the check, etc. I don't know if they were understaffed, but it was very frustrating.
author: B. Y.

description:
It is a little pricey, but it's cool that they provide for the Deaf community. They have a loyal group of customers. 

The food is pretty good and is quite diverse and flavorful. Service is geared towards both Hearing and Deaf customers, they even play music. Works for large groups too, just plan a reservation ahead of time.
author: Hannah J.

description:
My Dad and I went the night after they opened. We had a good experience at this place. Our BART train was late, so we arrived about 15 minutes after our reserved time. They still held our table for us, and everyone was very nice. 

We ordered the Mozzeria bar, which I didn't think was amazing. It wasn't super hot, and I can imagine if it were, it would have been much better. I'd have liked the sauce in a cup on the side instead of splattered all over, since it made the crust soggy and unappetizing. 

We ordered the duck pizza and the pancetta pizza. The crust on the pancetta pizza was burned, which made it not as delicious as I'm sure it could have been. The duck pizza was perfectly done, and it was absolutely fantastic, although it would have been nice to have more pieces of duck on it, or an option to pay more to add extra meat? We were both full after the pizza, so we passed on dessert.

The service was good, considering that they were crazy busy, although we did have to wait a while for the appetizer, which was a drag, since I could see it sitting on the bar cooling off when I would have liked to be burying my fork in it. The pizzas came out nice and hot though.

I was a little disappointed with the burned pizza, but I figure.. hey, it's their second day of business. Give them a little time, they're going to get it right. I also think the crust would benefit from a sprinkling of salt on the bottom. This prevents it from burning, and also gives it more flavor.  Melody and Russ, you need to visit Two Amy's in Washington DC... they have great ideas that you definitely should borrow for Mozzeria. 

CAVEAT EMPTOR: I'm friends with several people who work here and I know sign language.
author: Jane J.

description:
I've come here twice, and hope that there will be more visits in my future.  Both times I came on crowded weekend nights, and I didn't have to wait past my scheduled reservation time.  Service was nice and friendly, and on my second visit the owner recognized us and welcomed us back.  

Both times we had the Mozzeria bar--delicious!  On our first visit we shared the Italian sausage pizza.  I had, when reading the description, been wary of "white garlic sauce," but it was delicious.  The crust was super thin and the toppings were flavorful.  On our second visit, we shared the roast duck pizza--it was fantastic!  It would have never occurred to me to imagine a pizza with duck and Hoisin sauce.  I'm glad someone else imagined it and created it.  

The desserts sounded wonderful, but both times, we were so full from dinner we couldn't even contemplate dessert.  And there's no way I'm giving up that Mozzeria Bar appetizer to save room for dessert!  Maybe make a future dessert-only trip, or get it to go....

Parking is about what you would expect for that neighborhood, so be sure to allow extra time.  I find that singing "me and my parking karma, me and my parking karma" to the tune of the chorus from "Waltzing Matilda" is helpful.  But you have to really believe it will work.
author: Suedoan M.

description: Awesome pizza with awesome service.  Celebrated my 40th birthday at Mozzeria.  I was not disappointed.  Every pizza we ordered was fantastic.
author: Matt D.

description: We totally enjoyed our experience at Mozzeria.  It was very easy to get a reservation through open table.  The service was excellent and the pizzas delicious.  We loved the duck pizza which had a delicate sweet sauce.  The Neopolitan pizza was divine.  The carrot ginger soup was a winner as well.  We were greeted by a hostess who knew ASL and the waitress knew ASL too which was beneficial for the Deaf people in our group.  The pizza only took 90 seconds to cook in the beautiful Italian oven and we could watch from our seats.
author: Laurie J.

description:
Great pizza crust! Nice and chewy. Staff is friendly and decor is pleasant. I've lived across the street for 15 years and have seen a lot of restaurants come and go in that space. I hope they make a good run of it.

My only recommendation is for them to be a little more adventurous in the flavor profiles of the pizza. All the pizzas our group had tasted fine, but the toppings were the same combinations offered everywhere else (prosciutto and arugula, Italian sausage w/fennel and red onion, etc).  Each pizza needed something additional to make it a Mozzeria original. That said, I still plan to go back. Great crust and priced right!
author: paul p.

description: Pizza is solid, but I believe if they cook it a little longer they could get that authentic neopolitan burnt flavor accent.  It is present in their pizza, but a little understated.
author: p w.

description:
First off, the service was very friendly but terrible. It took five minutes to clear the table so we could sit down and then an additional 15 minutes to get water and even longer to place an order. When we finally got our pizza, we asked for additional plates so we wouldn't have to share the plate it came on.... well the waitress goes and runs credit cards right in front of us and we wait 10 minutes before we can start eating.

I know they haven't been open long so I hope they can get these quirks figured out. 

We had the porcini salame (very thinly sliced) with port jelly, which was delicious. And the prosciutto, arugula pizza was pretty decent too.
author: Liz Z.

description:
I went on their opening night and was blown away by the atmosphere. I had a reservation and was seated quickly and was served wine even more quickly. 

The owner was in front of the gigantic pizza oven, imported from Italy. He was warm, friendly, and made conversation with customers while feeding pizzas into the oven. I was disappointed that several items I wanted to try were already out, but pleasantly surprised with what I did order.

The red cabbage bruschetta was amazing! I never tasted anything like this before and I enjoyed every bite. Our table ordered several different pizzas so we could all share. My personal favorite is the blue cheese/caramelized onion combo. It melted in my mouth. If you're not fond for blue cheese, I wouldn't recommend this one. The margherita pizza was simple and yummy. 

The dessert!!! It was a slice of heaven. I had some lemon-y thing that my server suggested and I'd go back just for that. 

To sum it up, the food was wonderful, the atmosphere was friendly, and I only see this place getting better. I am planning on going back in the next week to try out the menu items that were out on opening night. Another review coming, maybe!
author: Tara H.

description: Do you want a quiet and friendly atmosphere???  This is the place to be!!!  The food is just befitting for your palate!!!  You won't be sorry here!!!
author: Kenneth R.

description: We just had the Rehearsal Dinner for my daughter's wedding here this past weekend. It was all arranged by her Mother-in-law so don't know all the details there...but we had the restaurant for just our party of 40ish for 2 hours. They let us decorate and we were served an incredible pre-ordered meal of so many courses I lost track! From salad, to eggplant, to pasta, pizza, dessert and more! Food was amazing! Service incredible. And everyone was extremely friendly and accommodating! Would highly recommend and can't wait to go back on our next visit to SF!
author: Ronda S.

description: I had a terrific meal here. The pizza was great and the service was attentive. I recommend it highly
author: Barbara W.

description: First time here and pleasantly surprised that it was fairly quiet at 6pm Friday night.  There are so many pizza places in the area but we wanted to try the wood oven pizza. The service was very prompt and friendly -- everyone was very nice and our server was very upbeat with lots of smiles and thumbs-ups. There were 3.5 of us (3 adults, 1 toddler) and we ordered a bottle of wine, 2 salads, meatballs, a margherita pizza and the duck pizza. The salads were very fresh -- could use some seasoning or more flavorful dressing, but still good. The pizzas were naan-like; very chewy and thin crust. We enjoyed them and there was plenty of duck on our pizza. The only item I probably would not order again is the meatball appetizer. They tasted fine but there were only 3 fairly small meatballs. I will instead spend the money on another pizza next time!  Some mentioned that it was a bit pricey but we spent about the same $ for dinner here as we would anywhere else in the neighborhood.
