I think it's probably expensive to run a business in SF and that part of town.  We liked the atmosphere and the food -- will definitely be back!
author: Amy H.

description: I loved everything about this place!  The food was delicious.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  The atmosphere was stylish and relaxed.  My husband and I will be back again and we've already recommended this place to a few friends.
author: Michelle M.

description: Margarita w/ mozzarella di bufala: flavorful and filling, despite the appearance of simplicity. Very friendly, deaf staff give it charm. I arrived without a reservation and they were able to sit me at the counter, where I watched the cooks making the pizza and maintaining the oven. It is a chic Mission bistro and the cost is around the same level as Beretta and Delphina. I found the "thin crust" comments to be exaggerated, but the reliance on a few delicious ingredients turns a standard pie into a possible stand-in for the pizza at a Roman bistro. As a hard of hearing individual this place makes me want to take up sign-language and very thankful that the unnoisy atmosphere made conversation easy.
author: Michael M.

description:
I am a pizza maniac. This is THE best pizza in the bay area/california and quite possibly the best I've ever had. It's the way pizza should be - light. The mozzerella and the buffalo mozzerella have the exact right amount of sauce (which is perfectly delicious - half tangy, half sweet), and the right amount of cheese, bubbly, crispy and chewy.  I think about this pizza often and I come from the east bay to get it. 

And if you know ASL or are learning, it's a really wonderful environment to be in. Otherwise, just come for the crazy good food.
author: Robin A.

description: The food is fantastic.  The staff is amazing.  The service is very efficient.  They take reservations, which is good because they're not a huge spot, so if they're busy, then there could be a wait.  The overhead music is a good selection.  The selection of food and beverage is excellent yet still fits on 2 sides of a menu which saves time.  I'll definitely come back! The only one tiny drawback is that they lack ice, so if you order a soda, you can get a glass but no ice.  Yet I still give 5 stars.
author: Michael S.

description: This place was excellence! I loved the veal meatballs!  All the employees were deaf and were signing to customers.  It is a great place to eat and the atmosphere is amazing. I love this place and will for sure be back.
author: Kj E.

description:
While the Mission has many great spots, Mozzeria shot to the top of my list after just one visit.  I've been back several times for both dinner and brunch.  The atmosphere and the food are comfortable, affordable, reliable, and cozy.  There are plenty of interesting ingredients to pique your interest and a friendly staff to pleasantly answer your questions (what exactly is a soubise again?)  
 This place  is solid.  The food is exceptional, and reliably so. More and more often I default to Mozzeria when hosting out-of-towners or just meeting up with friends for a great meal that won't break the budget.  The menu always presents new and unique options, while the service and quality are predictable in the best possible way.
author: Joan G.

description:
This restaurant was amazing!
Every dish was different from the other and absolutely yummy!
Be sure to have some of their small plates - we had the salmon small plate and the prosciutto with pickled cauliflower - fabulous!
I loved the ambience. I loved the food. And the service was excellent.
Everything was fresh, delicious and surprising.
The price was very reasonable and the quality exceptional.
The deaf and signing staff added even more to the terrific experience.
author: Sharon N S.

description: Mozzeria serves a tasty pie!  There is probably not a pizza place that gives you this much deliciousness for your dollar.  The service was great.  None of our party knew sign language but made due just fine.  Seriously seriously good pizza.  I will be back.
author: Tim R.

description: One of the best, if not the best, Margarita in town. Simple with Fresh Mozzarella and only $13. I feel like I am in Napoli and I love that! Definitely a spot to try!
author: Dimitri S.

description: We went for lunch with relatives visiting from Texas and enjoyed the food and friendly atmosphere. It was a great experience for my daughter and her cousin, both studying Speech and Audiology in college. We tried three different pizzas and they were all delicious.
author: Holly B.

description: I have been to Mozzeria twice. . .it is definitely not a place I can recommend to friends.  It disappoints me that I cannot recommend this place because I do really wish to support businesses that are deaf owned and operated.  However being  Deaf does not mean one is automatically qualified (no matter how some of the militant deafies wish to shove this philosophy down our throats).  At both visits, service was astoundingly slow and painful.  Forever to get the table, menu, food. . .but oh so quick with the check.  Food lacked flavor.  The mozzeria bar tastes like frozen cheese bar warmed up in the microwave and served with ragu sauce.  The red cabbage bruschetta dish was drowning in oil. . .that was all I could taste-oil.  The first visit  I had the prosciutto pizza; second I had the Italian sausage pizza.  Dough, oil, melted cheese, caramelized onion, meat. . .all mushed together with no distinctive flavor of any one of the ingredients.  Russ and Melody Stein (owners and operators) are fabulous people. . .I do wish them success.  However I wish for them to improve on the quality of service as well as quality of the food.  There is so much fierce competition on 16th Street in the Mission. . .one needs to really stand out to make it.  Right now. . .Mozzeria just does not stand out for me.
author: susan g.

description: I would like to have two separate ratings (one for food and one for the lighting environment).  We were there last Saturday and their food was GREAT (no acid in tomato sauce) and would give them the rating of 5. However, with our advice to them way in advance of our special needs - very well light spot to enable DeafBlind (only those who still can see well in well light spots due to their NIGHT blindness, especially DB with Usher's or RP). The ceiling light was not good and hard to see everyone on the table even tho they tried the best.  Our suggestion to owners is 1) install LED 120-watt light bulbs for ceiling lights (each bulb uses only 15 watts) as well as have two task light battery operated lamps on the table to enable those DB to see everyone chat and enjoy the whole time of dining.  It is fortunate that they have the plug outlet under the table to use for prolonging the battery life.  The rating for the lighting environment is 1. So, the average of both food rating and lighting rating is 3.  Hope owners will be doing something about ceiling lights and task light lamps (can be purchased on JoFabrics website, they are not expensive with 40 or 50 percent discount at times).  Thank you for giving us the great opportunity to experience at your place and we made the special trip from Greater Los Angeles area since we visited our younger son's family in Fremont and also we all went to your place.  Thanks again
author: Paul L.

description: Fantastic experience at Mozzeria.  It is a deaf owned business and the wait staff speak in sign.  My son is studying ASL and this was a homework project for him.  The food was fantastic and the experience twice as nice.  I recommend the beat salad - most unique and tasty beat salad I have had.
author: Tracy C.

description:
awesome food and awesome service
been here twice now, once w a big group for my birthday and once just w a friend.  both times the food was amazing and the service was good.  you can now call to make a reservation/check the wait; they have a translator who video chats w the staff.  pretty cool!  will definitely be back again!
author: Janine T.

description: momma mia! mozzeria!!!
author: larry j.

description: Went to Mozzeria on quiet, cloudy San Francisco summer evening with the fiance. We had a gilt city voucher which I presented and had no problem with redeeming -- they gave us the special menu for the voucher. We ordered the burrata and the mozzeria bar as appetizers. The housemade burrata was delicious and it was accompanied with deep fried dough which was different from other places and it was quite tasty and worked well. The mozzeria bar was basically a flattened, large mozzarella stick with a marinara moat, which was was excellent in our book. We ordered the spinach pizza and the margherita pizza. The real standout was the crust -- perfectly chewy, fluffy and crisp. The margherita was a solid pizza and we were pleasantly surprised that the vegan spinach pizza had great flavor and satisfied. We finished with the bombolini dessert which was executed well but we didn't like the flavor. The house red wine was standard. As you know, the restaurant is a deaf owned and operated establishment, which was neat. The service and ambiance were great and it was a fun weeknight date spot. We would recommend this place and would come back in the future.
author: T K.

description: We were just strolling along 16th looking for a change in pace when we happened to walk in and give Mozzeria a try. We had no idea that it is operated by hearing-impaired staff, and the level of service and quality of dinning experience we received was actually better than many other restaurants we have visited. The pizza was cooked to perfection, with just the right level of flavor imparted from the wood burning oven. The salads and pasta were also both so good we wanted to go back for more even the very next day. We're counting on this place to be our regular go-to spot from now on.
author: Eric S.

description: i went to mozz last night for the first time. i loved everything about the experience. not only was the food delicious (had the marg pizza with burrata and duck pizza) but they had a great wine list, a beautiful oven and lovely ambiance. i didnt realize that the restaurant was owned and operated by all deaf staff. the staff was so friendly and warm and made us feel right at home. we had to wait about 20 minutes (and had a reso) but we were given free wine and a free cheese plate- such nice service! it was a really special experience to see a community of people come together and be able to communicate with everyone. it was really  unique to dine in a place where the norm is to be deaf. i cant wait to come back here soon- really special eating experience!
author: Emmie B.

description: Pizza is good but would be excellent with a more generous dollop of olive oil.   They skimp on olive oil, resulting in a drying pizza.   Otherwise very good!
author: Rose C.

description:
As an Italian from the East Coast with very high standards for Italian food (which, PS, are often not met in SF, even by the swanky joints), I have to say that Mozzeria is OUTSTANDING! I think I had the best meatballs I've ever eaten last night. 
The space is unassuming but still comfortable and well-designed. But the food is the star. The pizza was excellent. The crust was slightly charred, thin but still elastic with just the right amount of chewiness, with tomato sauce and cheese that were just right by East Coast standards--tomatoes not too sweet, cheese not overpowering everything else--something that SF struggles with (yes, even you, Tony's Napoletana).  The gnocchi with veal meatballs was outrageously good! I used pizza crust to clean every bit of sauce off my plate.  Ditto the pea tendril salad with hazelnuts, blue cheese and mango. And dessert! The lightest cheesecake with a beautiful lemon sauce, almost like a lemon curd. Delectable!  And the staff is fantastic! Very friendly and warm and unpretentious-- Mark was our waiter and he was awesome.  We will go back over and over and over and........
author: Emme D.

description: I visited here on Friday night with my husband and my Deaf brother and sister in law. We were all very excited about our first Deaf restaurant experience! The place was packed and although we had to wait a bit for a table we didn't mind since we were treated with complimentary wine from the owner Melody. My husband and I are hearing and we noticed the music was pleasant (not too loud) and added to the nice ambiance. It was very exciting for all of us that everyone we encountered were fluent in ASL. Our server was a CODA (hearing Child Of Deaf Adult) and it was exciting for my Deaf in laws to be able to order in ASL! Melody the owner even mentioned that she may add ASL music videos to the flat screen TV at the bar in order to sync the audio music and visual ASL. Sounds great! The pizza was delicious! I ordered the eggplant yum! Everyone's food smelled and looked great! I am so happy that this wonderful Deaf owned restaurant is right here in SF! I hope many hearing people will come and try the great pizza and learn a bit about Deaf culture! I plan to go again soon!
author: Alicia S.

description: The service was great and food pretty good.  I would have rated this place higher, but i found the sports-bar like giant TV with basketball really off-putting for the space.
author: Troy B.

description: Great food, reasonably priced ( worked out at 15 dollars a head with tip). The waitstaff is hearing impaired, which makes the whole experience different ( in a good way) and the service is great.
author: Asha V.

description: My boyfriend and I visited this new pizza spot after reading an article in SFGate. We were pleased to find great service and great food. Above all we were both impressed by the warmth and hospitality of the restaurant owners and staff. The mission of this restaurant warms my heart. I hope it inspires others to also make a leap of faith and follow their dreams. Thank you Mozzeria for inviting us in and I hope your restaurant continues to succeed.
author: Erica C.

description: Food is perfect!!!!!  Actually PERFECTO!!!  But......the owners don't have time to personally respond to inquiries..They have hired a hack who does not convey their flavor at all.They  need to get someone else who knows their customers
author: Tom M.

description: Two thumbs up!  I would definitely go back there if I was not about 7 hours away from San Francisco!  The food was delicious and the customer service was amazing.  The only thing I think they need to improve is kids.  There is no kid's menu and my daughter had to drink water from glass cup (plastic cups with lids would be better).  Keep up the good work!  If we are in SF again, this restaurant will be on our top list!  :-)
author: Jamie N.

description: Loved this place! In my neighborhood, friendly staff,great food. My friend and I shared three small plates (beet salad, crispy pork,and the daily charcuterie plate), the eggplant pizza (better than any pizza I've had at delfina), and a great Cab. It was all delish!!
author: g C.

description: Great modern italian cuisine. I really love the gnoochi with pork ragu..best I ever taste (I can eat it everyday and I know I will never get tired of it). The pizza is great- thin crust and perfect sauce. Roast Duck pizza is a must! Hope the owners will open 2nd location in South California.
author: Joseph T.

description: yum. that's what i think the peeps from Naples intended to spread around the world.
author: Angelo M.

description: This place is a neighborhood gem.  Great flatbread style pizzas, lovely apps, a dynamic changing menu, even the house wine is good (and well priced).  The staff is friendly but I wish I knew a little more ASL than just Thank You!
author: Steve G.

description: Wonderful staff, great pizza.  The crust was a perfect balance of thin, crispy, chewy goodness.
author: J M.

description: I  really wanted to like this place. The staff are undoubtedly five star worthy. The service is really incredible and the atmosphere is great. Unfortunately the food just didn't really wow me. I've had better wood oven pizza for a lesser price.  The crust is awesome, but the ratio of toppings is a little out of whack. The bleu cheese pizza was a bit overpowered by the cheese (and I'm a huge bleu cheese fan) and the roast duck pizza was more like a few pieces of duck on some really tasty toast (very little sauce, other toppings weren't much of a compliment).  I'll probably go back just because I liked the atmosphere and the people.
author: Alex N.

description: omg so good! i loved this place.  i had the peking duck pizza and the pumpkin ravioli.  the pizza crust was perfectly crisp and the flavor was incredible.  the ravioli was amazing; the filling had a great flavor, so fresh.  definitely going back!
author: Matti K.

description: we loved the pizza, and the crab pasta was amazing.  warm service, and delightful atmosphere.  we'll be back
author: Mark S.

description: yet another fabulous find and quite the dining experience! such an awesome place and their concept of serving food is brilliant! space is small so def recommend reservations but we had their  pizza some wine had a lovely evening! highly recommend for attentive service, great food and great atmosphere!
author: sue c.
